alert.note: Alert for Obion; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 24 at 10:53AM CDT until March 25 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas, Southeast Missouri and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Clay, Craighead, Cross, Greene, Mississippi and Poinsett. In Southeast Missouri, Dunklin and Pemiscot. In West Tennessee, Dyer, Lake, Obion and Weakley. * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A stalled front with numerous showers and thunderstorms will drape across portions of northeast Arkansas, the Missouri Bootheel and northwest Tennessee today. Low pressure will track along the stalled front this evening with additional showers and thunderstorms. Rainfall amounts of 3 to 4 inches are possible in the watch area, with isolated higher amounts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
